I am unable to modify events when they are email invitation generated.  I have multiple calendars that are Google hosted.  The invitations are coming from an Exchange server.  
I cannot, but would like to be able to modify the following:
1.  The calendar the event is in.  When I accept an email invitation in Thunderbird, the event seems to be placed on one of my calendars in an arbitrary and unpredictable way.  
2.  The alarm settings.  
3.  The description.  It'd be nice to be able to add my own notes.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  Receive email invitation.
2.  Press accept.
3.  Switch to Calendar tab and double click on event. 
4.  Choose either "Edit just this occurrence" or "Edit all occurrences" in the dialog.  

Actual Results:  
The *only* editable item is the "Reply:"

Expected Results:  
Allow editing of:
1.  The calendar the event is in.  When I accept an email invitation in Thunderbird, the event seems to be placed on one of my calendars in an arbitrary and unpredictable way.  
2.  The alarm settings.  
3.  The description.  It'd be nice to be able to add my own notes.
comments.creator: mcb9@alumni.cwru.edu

comments.raw_text:
I migrated off Lightning a couple of years ago.  Today I installed the latest version of Lightning (3.3.1) and added in calendars to test.  

I tried with an existing meeting.  While the UI was nicer than I remember, the results were the same as I recorded before.  Check that, even worse, I couldn't change my status.  I was stuck on "confirmed".  It's completely read only.  

I tried creating an event in Exchange and inviting my gmail address.  I received the email in Thunderbird.  It recognized that it was for an event.  I clicked the "Accept" button.  This seemed to succeed, but then errored out because modification failed.
comments.author: mcb9@alumni.cwru.edu

comments.raw_text:
Mark, thank you for re-testing and reporting back. Changing the participation status and the alarm setting should work, while read only for description and calendar association is intended.

That the former are also read-only indicates a problem with the calendar as also the failure while adding the new event does. How have you integrated your Google calendar - via Caldav (using the new URI) or the Google Provider?
